data.name: ExceptionText
data.value: Currently only SQL and Access database providers can be edited.

data.name: Instructions
data.value:
Use this page to set properties that determine how membership information is stored. You generally set these properties only when first configuring membership.

Warning: If you already have membership data in the database, changing these properties can make the existing data unusable.

data.name: ProviderInstructions
data.value: Use this page to set properties that determine how site counter and page counter data is written to the database. You generally change these properties to optimize performance.

data.name: RoleProviderInstructions
data.value: Use this page to configure settings specific to Role Manager.

data.name: RoleDomain
data.value: The cookie domain setting determines when the Role Manager cookie will be sent by the browser. If you are using both Forms Authentication and Role Manager in your application, the cookie domain should be set to the same value for both features.

data.name: RequireQuestionAnswerExplanation
data.value: If you select this option, the user is required to create a question that he or she must answer correctly when requesting a forgotten or reset password.

data.name: RequireUniqueExplanation
data.value: If you select this option, only one user ID can be associated with a single e-mail address. Otherwise, multiple user IDs can be associated with the same e-mail address.

data.name: SpecifyHowOften
data.value: Specify how often the site counter information held in memory is flushed (written to the database).

data.name: SpecifyHowLong
data.value: Specify how long the site counter service should wait while writing out data information before logging an error in the event log.

data.name: SupportRetrievalExplanation
data.value: If you select this option, a user can choose to have a forgotten password sent to his or her e-mail address. Otherwise, a user cannot retrieve a forgotten password.

data.name: StoreSecure
data.value: Store password in a secure format

data.name: SupportResetExplanation
data.value: If you select this option, a user can choose to have a new password randomly generated and sent to his or her e-mail address.
